data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound that orders as a ferrimagnet below 90 K?
data.answer: [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]

data.question: What is the role of the [FeIIICl4]- anion in the structure of [FeII(TCNE•-)(NCMe)2]+[FeIIICl4]-?
data.answer: The [FeIIICl4]- anion occupies sites between the [FeII(TCNE•-)(NCMe)2]+ layers.

data.question: What unique structural feature does [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] possess according to the text?
data.answer: It possesses a novel planar μ4-[TCNE]•- spin coupling unit bonded to four FeII's.

data.question: How does the coercive field and remnant magnetization of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] at 50 K compare?
data.answer: The coercive field is 1730 Oe and the remnant magnetization is 7500 emuK/mol at 50 K.

data.question: What is the significance of the χT value at 300 K for [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]?
data.answer: The χT value at 300 K significantly exceeds the sum of the spin-only values for [TCNE]•- and high-spin Fe(II) and Fe(III), indicative of strong spin coupling.

data.question: What does the presence of 2222 and 2178 cm-1 νC≡N IR absorptions indicate about [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]?
data.answer: The presence of 2222 and 2178 cm-1 νC≡N IR absorptions indicate the presence of [TCNE]•-, not [TCNE]2-, bound to several iron ions.

data.question: What does the change in χT(T) behavior around 110 K indicate about the magnetic properties of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]?
data.answer: The change in χT(T) behavior around 110 K indicates the onset of significant short-range ferromagnetic coupling.

data.question: How does the structure of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] accommodate the preferred angles for N−Fe−N and the TCNE sp2 carbons?
data.answer: The structure accommodates the preferred angles through buckling of the layer, with C−C−N and C−N−Fe angles ranging from 163.2 to 175.4°.

data.question: What does the observation of a sharp peak at ∼90 K in both the real, in-phase, χ‘(T), and complex, out-of-phase, χ‘ ‘(T), AC susceptibilities suggest?
data.answer: It suggests an ordering temperature, Tc, of 89.7 ± 0.3 K for [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4].

data.question: What is the implication of the hysteretic behavior observed in the field-dependent magnetization, M(H), of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]?
data.answer: The hysteretic behavior implies magnetic ordering with a coercive field and remanant magnetization.

data.question: How does the synthesis of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] differ from previously reported organic-based magnets?
data.answer: It differs due to the presence of halide and a 1:2, not ∼2:1, TCNE:Fe ratio.

data.question: What does the presence of two crystallographically different environments for coordinated MeCN in [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the material possesses Fe in two valence states: FeII/III2(TCNE•-)Cl4·zMeCN.

data.question: Is [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] the first metal−TCNE magnet with direct bonding between metal ion and [TCNE]•- whose structure has been determined?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the [FeIIICl4]- anion form covalent bonds with the [FeII(TCNE•-)(NCMe)2]+ layers in [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4]?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the coercive field of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] at 50 K less than 1000 Oe?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the χT value at 300 K for [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] indicate weak spin coupling?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the novel planar μ4-[TCNE]•- spin coupling unit in [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] structurally reported for the first time?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the synthesis reaction of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] involve a TCNE:Fe ratio of approximately 2:1?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the magnetic ordering temperature (Tc) of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] above 100 K?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the structure of [Fe(TCNE)(NCMe)2][FeCl4] include a central C−C bond distance of 1.29(4) Å?
data.answer: True
